lead_paragraph: Dan Price, a co-founder of Gravity Payments, had been accused by his brother Lucas of overpaying himself and of using a corporate credit card for personal expenses.

headline.print_headline: Seattle C.E.O. Wins Suit Brought by His Brother
headline.main: Seattle C.E.O. Who Promised $70,000 Salaries Wins Suit Filed by Brother

snippet: Dan Price, a co-founder of Gravity Payments, had been accused by his brother Lucas of overpaying himself and of using a corporate credit card for personal expenses....
abstract: Judge Theresa B Doyle of Superior Court in King County, Wash, rules that Lucas Price, co-founder of Gravity Payments credit card payment processing firm, failed to prove in court that his brother and chief executive Dan Price had overpaid himself and inappropriately used company credit card for personal expenses; Lucas had filed suit following disagreement over Dan's plan to pay his workers at least $70,000 a year.
